action.action-desc: Mr. Gottheimer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Packers and Stockyards Act, 1921, to establish the Office of the Special Investigator for Competition Matters, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Meat and Poultry Special Investigator Act.

section.header: Office of the Special Investigator for Competition Matters
section.text: The Packers and Stockyards Act, 1921, is amended by inserting after section 415 (7 U.S.C. 228d) the following:

section.header: Office of the Special Investigator for Competition Matters

subsection.text: There is established within the Packers and Stockyards Division of the Department of Agriculture an office, to be known as the Office of the Special Investigator for Competition Matters (referred to in this section as the Office).
The Office shall be headed by the Special Investigator for Competition Matters (referred to in this section as the Special Investigator), who shall be appointed by the Secretary.

paragraph.text: use all available tools, including subpoenas, to investigate and prosecute violations of this Act;

serve as a Department of Agriculture liaison to, and act in consultation with, the Department of Justice and the Federal Trade Commission with respect to competition and trade practices in the food and agricultural sector;
act in consultation with the Department of Homeland Security with respect to national security and critical infrastructure security in the food and agricultural sector; and
maintain a staff of attorneys and other professionals with appropriate expertise.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding title 28, United States Code, the Special Investigator shall have the authority to bring any civil or administrative action authorized under this Act.
